title: How do bands that perform live with a backing track sync their live part to the prerecorded part? - Quora

response.answer_text: Via a metronome, more commonly just called a click these days. The drummer will be fed a click track into In Ear Monitors which counts in time with the backing tracks. Other musicians may be fed the click, it’s largely personal choice but is only possible if they are wearing In Ear Monitors, as obviously a click played through a monitor wedge would reach the open mics.

I will write it through points...1. Practice.... They practice the songs perfectly2. The backing soundtrack is made ready without vocals3. Microphones are muted for the on stage instruments.4. ONLY Vocalist's microphone is kept on...5. Rest is the job of a sound engineer like ME to make it sound better..for audience and music lovers like you \U0001f44d
